|Item_parent=Shock. Main aetiologies: hypovolaemic, septic (see item 158), cardiogenic, anaphylactic.
|Item_parent_short=Shock. Main aetiologies: hypovolaemic, septic (see item 158), cardiogenic, anaphylactic.
|Rank=A
|Title=Know the principles of management of anaphylactic shock
|Description=see item 332
|Heading=Management
|Contributors=Julien Poissy
|Order=13}}

Anaphylactic shock requires first-line injection of IM adrenaline!

Step 1: Condition monitoring and venous lines (see elements for immediate management of a state of shock)

Stage 2: management of shock

- Avoidance of the allergen

- Injection of adrenaline IM ++.

- Auto-injector pen if available

- Adrenaline ampoule 1mg diluted in 10 mL. Injection 0.01 mg/kg (0.5 mg per 50 kg)

- Location: lateral surface of the middle 1/3 thigh, in the vastus lateralis

- The IV route is possible but should be reserved for trained teams: titration +++ 0.001 mg/kg (10 times less than IM!)

- Repeat every 5 minutes

- Crystalloid volume expansion

Stage 3: Investigation and management of associated respiratory failure

- If respiratory distress: patient in sitting position

- Lower airway obstruction: aerosols of β2-mimetics (salbutamol)

- Upper airway obstruction: aerosols of adrenaline (5 mg nebulised)


NB: IV corticosteroid therapy with 1 mg/kg methylprednisolone is not an emergency and is used to prevent relapse. Antihistamines are only effective on mucocutaneous signs.

question.title: What is the recommended location for injecting adrenaline in anaphylactic shock?
question.description: The location of injection for adrenaline in anaphylactic shock

option_a.title: Lateral surface of the middle 1/3 of the arm
option_a.description: A plausible but incorrect location for injection

option_b.title: Lateral surface of the middle 1/3 of the thigh, in the vastus lateralis

option_c.title: Upper arm
option_c.description: A plausible but incorrect location for injection

option_d.title: Lower back
option_d.description: A plausible but incorrect location for injection

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the correct option
